You should eat for two during pregnancy.
Pregnant women only need about 300 extra: Pregnant women only need about 300 extra calories per day in the second and third trimesters, not double the food.
Morning sickness only happens in the mor: Morning sickness only happens in the morning.
Nausea and vomiting can occur at any tim: Nausea and vomiting can occur at any time of the day during pregnancy.
Pregnant women should avoid all exercise: Pregnant women should avoid all exercise.
Moderate exercise is safe and beneficial: Moderate exercise is safe and beneficial during most pregnancies unless advised otherwise by a healthcare provider.
Heartburn means the baby will have lots: Heartburn means the baby will have lots of hair.
Heartburn is caused by hormonal changes: Heartburn is caused by hormonal changes and stomach pressure, not directly linked to a baby's hair growth.
You cannot dye your hair while pregnant.
Occasional hair dye use is generally con: Occasional hair dye use is generally considered safe, especially after the first trimester, but consult your doctor.
You should avoid all seafood during preg: You should avoid all seafood during pregnancy.
Low-mercury fish like salmon and sardine: Low-mercury fish like salmon and sardines are safe and provide important nutrients such as omega-3 fatty acids.
There’s no scientific evidence that spic: There’s no scientific evidence that spicy foods trigger labor.
Flying is generally safe until the last: Flying is generally safe until the last month of pregnancy, though long flights may increase risk of blood clots.
Carrying high or low predicts the baby’s: Carrying high or low predicts the baby’s gender.
Belly shape depends on muscle tone, body: Belly shape depends on muscle tone, body type, and baby’s position—not gender.
Pregnant women should avoid sleeping on: Pregnant women should avoid sleeping on their left side.
Sleeping on the left side is actually re: Sleeping on the left side is actually recommended as it improves blood flow to the baby.
Cravings reveal what nutrients the baby: Cravings reveal what nutrients the baby needs.
Cravings are common but not reliable ind: Cravings are common but not reliable indicators of nutritional needs.
You cannot drink coffee while pregnant.
Moderate caffeine intake (under 200 mg p: Moderate caffeine intake (under 200 mg per day) is considered safe during pregnancy.
All herbal teas are safe in pregnancy.
Some herbal teas may be unsafe; always c: Some herbal teas may be unsafe; always check with a healthcare provider before consuming.
You can’t have any sugar while pregnant.
Moderation is key; occasional treats are: Moderation is key; occasional treats are fine as part of a balanced diet.
Warm baths are safe; only hot tubs and s: Warm baths are safe; only hot tubs and saunas should be avoided due to overheating risks.
Stretch marks can always be prevented.
Genetics and skin type play a big role;: Genetics and skin type play a big role; creams may help but cannot guarantee prevention.
Hormonal changes and sleep disturbances: Hormonal changes and sleep disturbances can affect memory and focus during pregnancy.
Heart rate can predict a baby’s gender.
There’s no evidence linking fetal heart: There’s no evidence linking fetal heart rate to gender.
Some vaccines, like flu and Tdap, are re: Some vaccines, like flu and Tdap, are recommended and protect both mother and baby.
Lifting your arms above your head can ha: Lifting your arms above your head can harm the baby.
There is no scientific basis for this be: There is no scientific basis for this belief; normal movement is safe.
Pregnant women should avoid all dairy.
Pasteurized dairy products are safe and: Pasteurized dairy products are safe and provide calcium and protein.
Cesarean delivery is the easier option.
C-sections are major surgeries with risk: C-sections are major surgeries with risks; recovery can be longer compared to vaginal birth.
You cannot have sex during pregnancy.
Sex is safe for most pregnancies unless: Sex is safe for most pregnancies unless a doctor advises otherwise.
Pregnant women should avoid vaccinations: Pregnant women should avoid vaccinations altogether.
Vaccines like flu and whooping cough are: Vaccines like flu and whooping cough are safe and recommended to protect mother and baby.
Labor always starts with water breaking.
Only about 15% of women experience water: Only about 15% of women experience water breaking as the first sign of labor.
Pets are safe; only cat litter poses ris: Pets are safe; only cat litter poses risk due to toxoplasmosis.
Belly size varies by body type and doesn: Belly size varies by body type and doesn’t reliably indicate baby’s size or health.
You must avoid cheese during pregnancy.
Only unpasteurized soft cheeses should b: Only unpasteurized soft cheeses should be avoided; pasteurized cheeses are safe.
Pregnant women should avoid all medicati: Pregnant women should avoid all medications.
Some medications are safe; always consul: Some medications are safe; always consult a healthcare provider before taking any.
Eating peanuts during pregnancy causes a: Eating peanuts during pregnancy causes allergies.
Eating peanuts in pregnancy does not inc: Eating peanuts in pregnancy does not increase allergy risk and may even reduce it.

What are the most important nutrients du: What are the most important nutrients during pregnancy?
Folate, iron, calcium, vitamin D, DHA (o: Folate, iron, calcium, vitamin D, DHA (omega-3), and protein are crucial for your baby's development and your health. They support everything from preventing birth defects to building strong bones.
How can I manage morning sickness?: How can I manage morning sickness?
Try eating small, frequent meals. Ginger: Try eating small, frequent meals. Ginger tea or chews can help. Avoid an empty stomach and choose bland foods like crackers or toast. If it's severe, talk to your doctor.
Is it safe to eat fish during pregnancy?: Is it safe to eat fish during pregnancy?
Yes, but it's important to choose low-me: Yes, but it's important to choose low-mercury fish like salmon, cod, and tilapia. Aim for 2-3 servings a week. Avoid high-mercury fish like shark, swordfish, and king mackerel.
How much weight should I gain during pre: How much weight should I gain during pregnancy?
It depends on your pre-pregnancy weight. Most women with a normal BMI should gain 25-35 pounds. Your doctor will give you a personalized recommendation.
PreggsCare is a comprehensive resource f: PreggsCare is a comprehensive resource for expectant mothers, providing guidance and support throughout the pregnancy journey.
